text: [EDIT: solved] Hi! I'm trying to define my own logging macro `@mylog` so that i works in a similar way as `@info` but whit, per say LoggingLevel of 500. I am not that familiar with making macro yet, amd definitely new to logging

text: To get started, check out `@edit @info "hi"`. This will show you the way `@info` is implimented

elements.text: . This will show you the way

text:
Thanks! It helped a lot. I have almost reached my goal.
```julia> using Logging

julia> const Verbose = LogLevel(500)
LogLevel(500)

julia> function Logging.show(io::IO, level::LogLevel)
           level == Verbose ? print(io, "Verbose") : Logging.show(io, level)
       end

julia> @logmsg Verbose "test" # the log I want
[ Verbose: test

julia>  macro verbose(exs...) @logmsg Verbose exs end
@verbose (macro with 1 method)

julia> @verbose "test" # the log I have
[ Verbose: ("test",)```
So, `@logmsg Verbose` gives me what I want, but I can't define properly `@verbose`  any idea ?

elements.text: Thanks! It helped a lot. I have almost reached my goal.

julia> using Logging

julia> const Verbose = LogLevel(500)
LogLevel(500)

julia> function Logging.show(io::IO, level::LogLevel)
           level == Verbose ? print(io, "Verbose") : Logging.show(io, level)
       end

julia> @logmsg Verbose "test" # the log I want
[ Verbose: test

julia>  macro verbose(exs...) @logmsg Verbose exs end
@verbose (macro with 1 method)

julia> @verbose "test" # the log I have
[ Verbose: ("test",)
gives me what I want, but I can't define properly

text: I think you just want `macro verbose(exs...) @logmsg Verbose exs... end`
I thought so too, but it gaves a syntax error. I am not that good with macro so I am still trying to understand what I'm doing ...

elements.text: I thought so too, but it gaves a syntax error. I am not that good with macro so I am still trying to understand what I'm doing ...

text: ah sorry. What you want actually is `macro verbose(exs...) :(@logmsg Verbose $(exs...)) end`

elements.text: ah sorry. What you want actually is

text: Ho I see, I have to provide an expr to be evaluated

elements.text: Ho I see, I have to provide an expr to be evaluated

text: The `:()` quotes the inside bit. The `$()` interpolates `exs...` into the quote. For more details, see <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/metaprogramming/>

text: glad to help! Macros are one of those things that you don't have to build often, so it can be a little overwhelming at first. (If you find yourself having to build them often, ask. A common new user trap is to try to use meta-programming when a function would have been better).
